title: [SOLVED]820-00165 no backlight (8.55v)
message:
This board had liquid damage in the area of the LCD Connector and had no backlight. I cleaned up the area and replaced all the components around it. Fortunately the other side of the board is spotless including the LP8550 area. I ended up having to replace the screen and I also replaced the LCD connector. Now I am getting 8.55v on Pins 3/4 of LCD connector and I can see the question mark folder. 
I noticed that BKL_PWM was 0.17v so I plugged the keyboard in and did a PRAM reset and it went up to around 1.6v. It seemed like the screen was less dim and I could see the question mark folder better. I tried putting the brightness up with the keyboard and that didn't work.

I removed R7704 and ran a wire to C7711 and 3v now is on BKL_PWM but still 8.55v is on backlight.

This board is a little different from the 820-3437 so I'm not sure how I can check if the feedback trace is fine. The feedback ball and the entire chip look perfect. Here are some more measurements

C7799 in diode mode - 0.614v
Pin 1(D7701) in diode mode - 0.419v and Pin 2 is 0.614v
BKL_EN - 2.85v
SMC_LID - 3.4v
There is continuity from Pin 2 of D7701 to Probe 1155 on the other side of the board

title: [SOLVED]820-00165 no backlight (8.55v)
message: Remove LED driver and check continuity from ball A5 to pin 2 of D7701. Not to mention you have a bad LP8550 which is pulling down the PWM signal in the first place.

title: [SOLVED]820-00165 no backlight (8.55v)
message: You were right. There was no continuty so I put a new LP8550 and ran a wire from A5 to Probe 1155 and now its working fine. Thanks.
